title: Isothermally Compressed Ideal - Why P Increases

content.question: An ideal gas in a cylinder is compressed isothermally. Which of the following best explains why the pressure of the gas increases?

choices.label: The average speed of the molecules increases.
The mass of the particles increases.
The magnitude of the average force of the collisions of the molecules with the wall increases.
The rate of molecules colliding with the wall per square meter increases.

content.answer: The rate of molecules colliding with the wall per square meter increases.

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
